case_vignette: A 30-YEAR-OLD MALE PRESENTS FOR EVALUATION OF A DARK DISCOLORATION ON THE POSTERIOR THIGHS PRESENT FOR THE PAST MONTH. HE DENIES ANY TOPICAL PRODUCTS APPLIED TO THE AREA. HE DENIES ANY PAIN OR PRURITUS AT THE AREA. HE HAS NOT TRIED ANY TREATMENTS. THE RASH HAS BEEN STABLE IN SIZE, IS CONSTANT, AND IS NOT SIGNIFICANTLY GROWING IN SIZE. HE WORKS A DESK JOB AND REPORTS SITTING ON A SEAT WARMER OVER THE PAST SEVERAL YEARS. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION REVEALS RETICULATED LACY BROWN PATCHES ON THE POSTERIOR THIGHS AND LOWER BUTTOCKS.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a dark discoloration on the back of my thighs that's been there for the past month.
Is the discolored skin itchy, painful, or showing any changes in texture?
No, there is no pain, itchiness, or changes in texture in the discolored area.
Have you recently experienced any trauma or injury to the affected area?
No, I haven't experienced any trauma or injury to the affected area.
Have you noticed any changes in your body weight recently, whether gain or loss?
No, I have not noticed any changes in my body weight recently.
Do you have any pre-existing health conditions or are you on any medication currently?
No, I do not have any pre-existing health conditions and I am not on any medication currently.
Does anyone in your family have similar skin issues or any known genetic skin diseases?
No, nobody in my family has similar skin issues or any known genetic skin diseases.
Has the affected area been exposed to prolonged pressure, such as sitting for long periods, or any other forms of consistent pressure?
Yes, I have been sitting on a seat warmer at my desk job for several years, which could have been prolonged pressure on the area.
**Final Diagnosis:** Erythema ab igne.
